Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: helen31essex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel as the one we had previously booked was awful. We walked in off the street and was met by very friendly staff who showed us a couple of rooms so we could choose which one we wanted. The rooms were clean, tidy and airy. We had a nice large en-suite with clean towels everyday. We had a fridge in the room and the breakfast was good. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke very good English (nothing was to much trouble for them, even down to making us tea when the bar had closed). Definately worth staying here. It was not posh but worth the 3 stars it has and is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Central Rome, you can do better”
Reviews.Author: derosa77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located centrally, however be advised to look for another hotel. Asked for a double bed & ended up with twin beds in a dingy dark room with a tiny window. Older receptionist gent & older bow-tied waiter were rude/arrogant. Bathroom was clean. Perhaps Rome accommodation is expensive anyway - but shop around. One advantage was the close vicinity to the Termini if you need to catch a train in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - just”
Reviews.Author: Wayne J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, reasonably located, and well priced, but if I was visiting Rome again I'd look elsewhere. Not convinced the concierges always have the customer's interests first and foremost when recommending tours and restaurants etc., and some of their recommendations turned out to be hilariously bad. Also, while it is centrally located, the surrounding area was a bit lifeless, and after dark it was quite dull though perfectly safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: SenLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night. This hotel is strategically located, within walking distance to Termini and adjacent to Via Nazionale. Rome is relatively small and lots of attractions are pretty close to each other and hence can be done by walking. The location of Hotel Centro made a perfect starting point by strolling down along via Nazionale and then to other attractions. The hotel room is very spacious and we were given a room with terrace. Decent hotel supplies. The decoration and furnitures are tired looking but the room is clean. Breakfast was okay. The hotel staffs are helpful, speak fluent English, they provided us map and showed us where to eat, what to avoid and safety tips.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: wanderingirl23
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centro is just a short walk (5 mins) from Termini so is ideally located for access to trains and the Metro. There are a few places to eat around the area and a supermarket located on a corner close by....so location wise it is ideal although certainly not in the most scenic part of town...but everything is a short walk or metro ride away. The hotel itself is your standard three star....provides all the services you require (Free WiFi and breakfast) but is a little aged and tatty around the edges. The rooms are large and spotlessly clean but some of the funishings have seen better days. The staff are friendly and helpful...and from what i heard speak a number of different languages. All in all you get what you pay for....a conveniently located hotel, a large , clean room (not always the case in Rome) in a hotel that is a little frayed around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Find Ever: central location, best Hoteliers, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: techerufole
Reviews.Content: The last of our 3 week leg in France/Italy we stayed at Hotel Centro--just returned home 2 nights ago! All our hotels were fabulous, but I would have to say this was our favorite and the best: Great sleep, great location for both safety, restaurants, and metro/train connections. Hotelier Bruno greeted us--he was kind, friendly, helpful, professional, and made us feel very welcomed and not a burden at all. We used Rick Steve’s Italy book for much of our trip. Although all the hotels he recommends seemed booked, one in particular--Hotel Sonya was the most unfriendly place we ventured into. The man at the desk did not say one word--literally not even a hello. He glared at me and let me get through my asking if he had a room for 5 nights and just shook his head and glared. I wonder how much they paid Rick to be advertised in his book? Obviously it was not for hospitality, friendliness, or otherwise, for those qualities were definitely not their main concern. In the end, we were quite glad they were booked as we found Hotel Centro. Many guests at Hotel Centro were Rick Steves’ followers as well. We all wondered why Hotel Centro was not in his book??? It was all our favorite place to stay and agreed that is was a good find. I really cannot say enough about the hotel: Rooms were large, our king bed was 2 twins, but we never noticed. Our bathroom was the largest we had at any stay--I could put all my toiletries on the counter!!! The breakfast, which comes with the room, was excellent: a nice assortment of meats, cheeses, hard rolls, sweet rolls, juices, coffee, hot chocolate, steamed milk, water, milk, cereal [including an especially delicious unsweetened oat, nuts, and raisin granola], yogurt, and fruit--fresh, as well as canned prunes and fruit cocktail [maybe I missed some items???]--superb!!! The gentleman that prepared breakfast worked hard at replenishing food, cleaning up the tables for the next guests, and washing up the dishes. Then there were the two very friendly Hoteliers: Francesco and Bruno: Each was kind and friendly, and eager to help and make recommendations. We were five minutes from the metro and Termini Train station. My husband had wondered how much it might cost to get a taxi to the train station from Hotel Centro. Bruno suggested we just walk as it was only a couple of blocks away [it was probably less than a five minute walk and we only had a backpack on wheels and a small backpack on our backs]. When my husband went to the desk at another time, Francesco was searching for the best and least expensive ride to the airport for us--he actually had a really good price via taxi if we needed it; but, we had one day left on our Euro rail pass and we had to decline. I was impressed that they didn’t wait for us to ask, they acted upon what they perceived as our needs and out of kindness and just doing a great job all around. It is what they do! Great service. Our room was always clean and done efficiently. One morning we went to breakfast and when we returned it was completely cleaned and ready for us. I seriously cannot say enough good about Hotel Centro, Bruno, Francesco, and the gentleman that prepared our breakfast {I wish I would have asked his name as well as he worked so hard} were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: shysue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in Sept 2011 and found it to be all that we needed and more. Room was clean and large enough for us, although the bed was a bit, um, firm. Must be common in Rome though, because we stayed at another hotel in the area when we got back from our cruise and the bed was identical. A little like laying on a large slab of clay with sheets, it felt odd. Just my perception of it, maybe. It was a back room (away from the street) so it was quiet. And the hotel is in a safe area. We never felt unsafe while walking the streets at night in this neighborhood. The breakfast they offered was quite sufficient to get us started in the morning - wonderful coffee (from a machine, but very good), sweet rolls, not-so-sweet rolls, cheeses, deli meats (salami and mortadella?), cereal, yogurt, fruit. Buffet style so self-serve, but there was also an attendant offering cappuccino or espresso from a very nice machine in the back which only he was allowed to operate. He never asked us (don't know why), but we saw him offering cappuccino and espresso to others in the dining room. The real upsides to this small hotel were the price and the location. So central to so many sites, and about a 5 minute walk to a metro station (Repubblica) and maybe 10-15 minute walk to the main Termini station. Via Nazionale is 1/2 a block away with restaurants, banks, shops, etc. This hotel was at least 50 Euro less than other hotels in the area, and with the breakfast included it was a great value. Hotels in Rome can be very expensive, so this was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great people, and central”
Reviews.Author: cacwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and was very convenient as it was close to every where. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast man was very funny. Although the room was tiny my husband and 2 kids were not complaining as it was only to sleep in it. I would recommend this

Reviews.Title: “Well sited property”
Reviews.Author: Jill043
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with a break in between as we went on a short tour elsewhere. The hotel location was fine, a quiet, safe area with easy access to the sights of Rome, restaurants, the bus and the major station. The staff were pleasant, friendly and helpful in suggesting ways to get around and places to eat. The rooms were clean, of a reasonable size, fitted with all amenities and quiet. Unless you opened the shutters the rooms were dark. Opening the shutters was not a problem! There was no view, but that was not important. Some of the fittings were a little tired and we had problems with both showers (in two different rooms). The lift was playing up when we arrived but was quickly repaired. The hotel happily stored our luggage when we went on tour. The breakfast was good, the dining room comfortable and clean. I was a little concerned about uncovered meat lying around for a couple of hours in the mornings. Internet was free. It was a pleasant place to stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa B
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place that is clean, no fuss and great people who look after you, this is the hotel for you. We stayed in Rome for 5 days and it was like we were staying with family. The rooms are very clean and quite big for europe standards. The price was great for the location. Central to everything and the boys at the front desk are so helpful and lovely. Just got back and am planning to go their next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service and good location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGalah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family for three nights and enjoyed it. The hotel is central but in a quiet location. The staff are very helpful and we were well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ckaus
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 days stay. We walked from the train station with our bags and found it a easy 15 mins walk. Francesco from the front desk was very helpfull and advised us about restaurants for dinner. We had a back room on the 3rd floor which was quiet, comfortable and clean. It is in a very quiet street with hardly any traffic. If you had the airconditioner on it whistled, but if you opened the window a little bit it stopped. The breakfast room was very small and down in the basement, but there was not a big range of food but was adequate and tasty. It became congested when everyone wanted breakfast at the one time. Having free internet was certainly convienent. Would certainly use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but......”
Reviews.Author: Sl1809
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel in a great location close to Termini Station, but don't mind rooms that are old and tired then this hotel is for you. We spent 3 nights in total, 2 before our tour and 1 after so stayed in 2 different rooms. Both were disappointing with old and very tired decor and hard beds, although they were quiet. Breakfast was okay although the room is small and became crowded later on the morning - recommend early breakfast. The staff were helpful, allowing us to leave our excess luggage during our tour which was a bonus. Would not chose to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Hall_10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Centro in Rome is in a fantastic location, as you can walk to shops, restaurants and the railway station. The rooms are fine, but if you have a small child the port-a-cot was a nightmare and kept collapsing and they only had one available. Breakfast was very average, but the staff were helpful and the little bar in the hotel was quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Centro, as the name implies, very central”
Reviews.Author: nicfal
Reviews.Content: Quite a good city type hotel, clean, comfortable and very central, just off a major shopping area. It is practically within walking distance of all major Rome attractions. Like most 3 star city hotels, rooms are slightly on the smallish side. Also very close to Terminini station, where one can get either of the two metro lines, which can get you close to were you want to go within a few minutes

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Orangelaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Centro twice during our Italian Escapade. Firstly for two nights before we headed north to Cinque Terre and then for a further 5 nights after our travels. Bruno told us he could hold our luggage if we only wanted to take one bag when we traved north, which was a HUGE bonus for us. The hotel was clean, breaky excellent and free Wi down on the first floor and was VERY central. It was within easy walking distance to the laundramat and to many great restaurants. Bruno himself was an absolute gem. I had gotten quite ill during my stay and Bruno arranged everything from calling the doctor to going to pick up my scripts himself. If you are going to stay there ask for the rooms at the top with the large balconey overlooking the street. Noise isnt a worry as the street is VERY quiet. He also arranged for a driver to take us to the airport. We felt totally spoilt during our stay there and NOTHING was too much trouble for Bruno. Would thoroughly recommend Hotel Centro. Happy travelling

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: UkShorty
Reviews.Content: Although it is only a 3 star the hotel has an excellent location and the staff were very helpful to us in arranging trips etc. If you don't have lots of cash this is a good option and the hotel rooms were lovely and quiet being on a side street of the most busy street in Rome. 10 min walk to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a great location”
Reviews.Author: AJSG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights before a cruise. The hotel was in a great location; walking distance to Termini Train Station as Spanish Steps, bus and metro lines. The continental breakfast was fresh and plentiful with cereals, bread and cold cuts, pastries and the best cappucino. The front desk gentleman, Francesco was very helpful in giving us advice and directions. The room was very basic fitting to the hotel s three star rating, but the cleaniness of the room rivaled many five star hotels, it was spotless. Great value we will definitatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and economical”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Tourist17
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station, easy to find. Close to Metro and everything you need. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious enough for re-packing at the end of our trip! The staff helped us out by taking our metro passes and arranging a trip directly to the airport. We had already made the arrangements and didn't ask but were very appreciative of the effort - makes a big difference getting a ride to the airport at the end of a busy vacation. Lowest price we paid in Italy for the most space. Great breakfast included as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fdphd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centro was an excellent hotel. It is near the Rome Termini Railway Station, the Opera House and just a short walk to the Colosseum, Forum and Trevi Fountain. The rooms are very clean and the service is excellent. The breakfast does not have a lot to choose from, but is enough to get you started. Overall, we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual -”
Reviews.Author: bigmarty
Reviews.Content: We always choose the Centro which provides outstanding value for money. It is well situated on a very quiet side street off Via Nazionale, a five minute walk from Republica metro and ten minutes from Termini railway and bus station. The rooms are of a good size, very clean and well furnished. Breakfast, with a good range of food, is included in the price. The desk staff are exceptionally helpful. Thank you Alberto for your many kindnesses on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Try other options....”
Reviews.Author: JJShank
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel we stayed in Europe for our 3 week trip and bar none it was the worst. It was old, out dated and the hardest beds that we experienced after all 3 weeks in Europe. It was ok to stay but there are so many other options I would try those first.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet little hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SAM.46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Centro for 9 days in August 2011. Initially given room 108 ( below stairs ) there was a window but high up the wall so you could not look out. We asked to be moved and we were the following day to rm 216 ( much better ) No bath just shower but hey ho you cant have everything. Breakfast great - sets you up for the day. Location to all the sights fantastic - and good location for tube. Front staff great and helpful - they like you to speak a little italian to make the effort ! Room numbers especially - due cento seidichi !!!! for example. Excellent holiday overall - would love to return to this hotel but not to room 108 por favour xxx and not in August - too hot and crowded. ( we had a quad rm by the way )

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for Price”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteSWN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner (we are both 18) for 3 nights and found it in a very convinient location only a few minutes walk from the terminus which proved useful for getting taxis to areas like the vatican, and it was only a 10minute walk from trevi fountain and the colluseum. The area it is in seems fine we didnt see any dodgey characters so felt safe walking back to the hotel at night and it is on a quiet street without a major road nearby so was very quiet considering its central location. We were greeted politely by staff particularly the man who helped carry our bags up, who was friendly and chatty. We had a double room which luckily for us was the one with the balcony right over the front doors so we had a nice view down the street. The rooms are admittedly smaller than you would get in say a travel lodge or similar, however, there was a standard size double bed, a wardrobe, a minifridge, a safe, a chair and a bedside table each with room to walk right around 3 sides of the bed so we didnt find the size any kind of problem and from what I've heard it is common for rooms in Rome to be slightly smaller than england so i think this hotel was pretty standard in that sense. The rooms were completely clean along with the bathroom which had a really nice good sized shower, and bedding and towels were changed for us everyday which mantained the clean and fresh feel of the room. The best thing we found was that there is a very good air conditioning system in the rooms which was a great relief to come back to after hours in the hot July sun, it was easy to alter the temperature a few degrees either way and so we slept very comfortably at night. Breakfast was actually a pleasant surpirse, neither of us are picky or had particularly high expectations but there was a coffee machine, fruit juice and water cereal such as muslei and cornflakes, pastries, bread rolls along with all sorts of butter and jam, fruit, ham and cheese amongst other things, so we found plenty to eat. There was also a computer downstairs which anyone could use so we went online a few times. Overall, the hotel had everything we needed and for a very reasonable price. Definately recommended for people on a small budget who just want somewhere clean and cool to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Probably what I paid for...”
Reviews.Author: Belsier
Reviews.Content: If you're considering the Hotel Centro, then you are undoubtedly looking for a moderately priced hotel in Rome which the Hotel Centro certainly is. I suspect, however, that you may be able to find a bit nicer place for the same price. On the positive side, our room was quiet, the bathroom was clean, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. If that is basically all you need, then the place was fine. On the not so positive side, the air conditioning didn't work very well; it cooled the room somewhat, but if you turned the temperature down, it simply turned off. Also, the bedspread was so dirty that I couldn't bear to even sit on it, so I just turned it back and sat on the sheets while relaxing or watching TV. As others have commented, the breakfast was not particularly appetizing though it was adequate to get a start on the day. As for the offered "taxi" service to the airport, it is actually an independent company that the hotel makes arrangements with. The clerk offered to arrange a ride to the airport for us for 60 Euro which we were to pay directly to the hotel. Fortunately, I was aware that by law a certified Rome taxi can only charge 40 Euro for a trip to the airport, and when I mentioned this, he quickly lowered the price to 45 Euro (which I felt was ok for the convenience). But I'm sure many other guests have ended up paying the unnecessary extra fee. Next time I'm in Rome, I will probably try a different place, though I'm not sure if other three star hotels in Rome will be any better. I was looking for inexpensive accommodations and I probably got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: smithrh
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this most convenient Roman hotel on our trip to Italy. The accomodation was very good, with good sized rooms for Rome, clean neat and all conveniences working well. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of fresh and tasty items, except the juice.The service and staff especially the manager Michele were professional, friendly and very helpful. The location is brilliant being close to Termini Station and yet within easy walking distance to most of Rome's highlights. The street is quiet even though at each end are major Roman thoroughfares. We had a fine choice of eateries at very reasonable prices as well as being close to specialty shopping, supermarkets, markets and food stalls. I would highly recommend Hotel Centro and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lkstotravel
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room. Very small. The room was clean and staff friendly and helpful. Spoke good English. The location was great! In walking distance to most everything except the Vatican. We were there 4 nights and each night was very quiet. Breakfast had a nice assortment of items and beverages. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: wendy_hays
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel in a small ralatively quiet street an easy 5 -10 minute walk from Central Station. Rooms are basic but clean. Front reception staff speak excellent english and are prompt, helpful and business like. A good range of food available for breakfast - a variety of pastries, fresh and canned fruits, cereals, yoghurt juices and the usual hot drinks. Free computer just off lobby a bonus. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: LaurieG62
Reviews.Content: Wonderful spot, right behind the Rome Opera House. Near the Underground. Long hot showers, gorgeous little balcony (piazza), where we could have afternoon snacks, olives & wine. Breakfast average. Internet only available in public areas.Very enjoyable stay, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price, location, helpfulness of desk staff”
Reviews.Author: ddd75
Reviews.Content: Good value for price, location, helpfulness of desk staff

Reviews.Title: “Would come back”
Reviews.Author: 69w
Reviews.Content: All major attractions are in walking distance from Hotel Centro Roma. However, after two days of walking we started to use public transportation a lot :) The location of this hotel is perfect. I would not change it to any other. Hotel is located within 10 mins walk from Termini Station, 5 mins walk from Piazza Republica (subway station), 2 mins walk from Via Nazionale bus stop... TIP: Buy "ROMA PASS" (25 Euro). Roma Pass will let you use city transportation for three days for Free, + it comes with Free tickets for two attractions (museums or archeological sites), + discounted other attractions, + YOU WILL SKIP THE LINES OF THOUSANDS TOURISTS at the entrances. I was so happy we got ROMA PASS. Back to the Hotel :) We stayed in Room 314 (a balcony is right above the flags/entrance). I liked the room. If you have a chance to choose, ask for this room. I would do that next time. - Receptionist Francesco is a nice and intelligent man. He will become your friend after the very first talk :) - A maid-girl does a great job here! One day we came back to our room for a short break from walking, but our room wasn't cleaned yet. We've said to a maid that she doesn't have to clean our room today. She said Okay... but a minute later knocked and asked if she can empty trash cans and change our towels :) A very sweet girl! - Breakfast was good. Some reviews say about bad breakfast. I cannot imagine what these people expect to have. It is 3-star hotel, and I've expected worse than i got. I was really surprised by breakfast. A coffee machine makes Cappuccino better than in Starbucks. We had juices, bread, ham, cheese, yogurts, serials/milk, fruits, five types of croissants, jam, butter, etc. - Room was large enough for two, a shower cabin was large and clean. - No English channels on TV... MTV and Fashion channels were more than enough for watching before bed time. - Hotel is located on a small street with no traffic. So it was quite during night time. One night, however, our neighbors with three kids were singing some Italian songs around 10-11PM... Unfortunately, you cannot pick your neighbors :) - Safe Box in a room was good to have - We have taken a few drinks from a fridge/bar (kinda expensive) but again- good to have an option - A balcony was a great addition to the room. TIP: when you go to a balcony, push-down a hanger/opener on an inside door, play with it to understand how it works. Otherwise, you may end-up locked on a balcony :) It has happened to me :) I had to scream from the third floor in my "not-perfect" Italian, asking pedestrians to call a receptionist :) - The supermarket is around the corner (3 mins walk) - Via Nazionale is the best street for shopping in Central Roma (pricewise / quality wise). We have found better cloths on via Nazionale than in Roma outlet mall (closest to Rome). TIP: Do not go to the mall (Castel Romano Designer Outlet Mall). It is a waste of time. Shop on Nazionale and Del Tritone ("Barberini" next subway stop from "Republica"/Nazionale) - Francesco had offered a "taxi"-friend for taking us to an airport. Certainly, it was more expensive than Leonardo Express from Termini (10 Euro more). But 6AM walk to Termini and a ride with all the luggage in a rain... So a "morning pick-up" from hotel was another thing we didn't regret we ordered from this hotel. TIP: Talk to Francesco about a pick-up reservation a few days in advance - NO COMPLAINS AT ALL! IT WAS A PLEASANT STAY. WOULD COME BACK! TIP: Lower your expectations, relax, and enjoy the city! PS. We had a bad experience at the next door restaurant Trattoria. Just pass it by. There is a better restaurant in every other corner in this area.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but be careful”
Reviews.Author: UsMutts
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centro is in a good location just a couple of blocks from the Roma Termini train station, which provides train service, the "Leonardo Express," to and from the airport. The staff speaks English very well. My problem with this hotel is the fact that we were given a room the size of a walk-in closet, even though we had guaranteed reservations for a premium room for several months in advance. We were told there had been a mistake in reserving rooms and our original room had been taken. The room was so small that there was no space for more than one straight back chair in addition to the twin beds which had been pushed together. There was a small refrigerator but it did not work. The phone for the room was in the bathroom above the toilet. After a couple of days we left the bath towels on the bathroom floor to signal a need for clean towels, but the housekeeper just hung them back up wet on the towel racks. No clean towels. A breakfast was included with the price of the room but it was not worth eating.. There is an attractive trattoria just steps from the front door of the hotel. Don't spend your money there. The waiters are rude, condecending, and arrogant. We mentioned this unpleasantness to the Hotel staffer and he said he had heard plenty of complaints about this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel, centrally situate4d and fair value”
Reviews.Author: Jeff312659
Reviews.Content: Clean, centrally situated, reasonable value for Rome. Rooms old but comfortable enough. No tea making facility though and service is at times churlish (but this is always so in Rome!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great staff! Great Price! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PaulandNella
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the last 7 days of our honeymoon and couldn't be happier with our choice. The price was very reasonable (about $95 a night except around new years eve) and included a lovely buffet breakfast, FREE WiFi (stayed at 4 star places that didnt even offer free wifi). But what really makes for a good stay (particularly in a 3 star hotel) is the cleanliness and the staff. The room and bathroom was very clean. Reasonable size too for Italy! And all the staff were very friendly and helpful! We stayed up till 2:30am new years eve chatting to the staff after walking home from the Colosseum. Great location within a few minutes walk from Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountains, Collosseum etc. Next door to the Metro and literally next door to a laundry service. We would gladly stay here again as it met all our fussy criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Really ideal for Rome on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jrf25
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out great for us for spending 3 nights in Rome. In July it was vital to have air conditioning. It is very close to the Metro lines which you have unlimited ridership on with the Roma pass, so each afternoon we'd return to the hotel during the hottest part of the day for siesta. We didn't eat in any of the nearby restaurants but we did use the cute grocery store that was only a couple blocks away (in a basement, which was odd). There was also a full-service laundromat next door (though it is a bit pricey at $30; we paid only $20 in Barcelona, but everything was less expensive in Barcelona) so we were able to have our laundry done one day while we were sightseeing. The rooms were clean and small with en suite bathrooms and I really don't think we could have lived without the a/c. The breakfast was good and included in the rate. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the elevator worked. Really couldn't ask for more for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in this hotel added to our enjoyment of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: kasbc
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Members of the staff (especially Francesco) were friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. We appreciated their willingness to speak English when necessary while at the same time encouraging us to try out our limited Italian. Breakfast was more than adequate - fresh and plentiful. Our room was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, staff and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nikkileee
Reviews.Content: Located so close to all forms of public transport, this hotel was a real gem. The staff were very helpful and friendly, with a wonderful sense of humor. They even tried to teach us some basic Italian! The room was comfortable and spacious, with a generous sized bathroom. Minimal noise. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: u2by
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this wonderful hotel - great location close to the main train station and easy access to the major sights. The front office staff were very helpful and kind at all times. Breakfast was included and included a great array of rolls, jams, fruit, cold meats and cheeses, coffee machine to make your favourite coffee or the waiter would get you hot water from the kitchen for your tea. The room was spotless we could fault this at all - small but very functional - TV, hair dryer and bathroom amenities. Overall I could not fault this hotel at all for the price and locaion and would recommend to friends and others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kel_au
Reviews.Content: This is an older style hotel, but clean and in a great location. Easy walking distance to buses and trains. Would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Stimmo25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights separated by a night away on a short tour and the staff were great - helping me confirm tour details and looking after our baggage while we were away. Also setting up early breakfast so we would not miss out on our tour pick up day. The location was within a 5-10 minute walk from Roma Termini station and within walking distance of most of the major attractions and close to the subway as well. The rooms were clean and comfortable although the air conditioning was a bit noisy. There was free wi fi in the bar area. All in all we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near termini station...”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic007
Reviews.Content: Great location, near termini station, metro stop, bus routes, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps etc. Rooms are plain but very adequate. Room & bathroom large & clean. Good air con. Quiet room. Comfortable bed. Staff friendly. Breakfast was typical of euro hotels-cold meats, cheeses, breads, cereal. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelToo63
Reviews.Content: pros: Good location. cons: A bit out of date and in need of refurbishment. AC not very effective. We stayed three nights. Were given a room on the first floor and was really small for a family of four. The worst part was that the AC was not at all effective. Service was great though, the front desk staff was very friendly and accomodating. They changed our room the next day to a slightly bigger room and a marginally better AC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Central Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: furkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Centro Hotel towards the end of July. It was fairly easy to find, although had I not looked up directions on google.maps first I might have gotten lost. Italy generally does not have very good signage. We arrived at the hotel and was greeted by Alberto at the front desk. One of the nicest people we met on our trip. He was so helpful with everything from directions to helping choose a restaurant. Our room was on the third floor. It was very comfortable, and bigger then we expected. We didnt hear street noise unless we had the window open, which often we didnt because of the heat. The air-con worked ok, was slightly noisy. The bar fridge didnt work very well until there was a blackout one afternoon and after that it worked well. Not quite sure what that was about. The room was always kept clean for us and was in a great location. 5min walk from a metro stop and 10min walk from Termini station. Its right near Nazionale Road which had lots of shopping and 5 min walk to a supermarket with a deli. Breakfast was always filling and the breads, meats and pastries on offer were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very friendly receptionists,great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMklondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, reception staff was absolutely superb, they will help you with everything, less than 7 minutes from Termini,breakfast is good, too sweet for my liking,but thats what italians like to eat,clean rooms with air con...overall highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and safe location for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Katkos
Reviews.Content: Hotel located on safe side and walking distance of train station (termini). Breakfast for ample, staff professional and everything was walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dferencz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Hotel Centro at the beginning of a 2 week trip around Europe. This hotel is a great bargain (under 100 euros) in Rome! The standard room was typical for Rome (smaller than US, but plenty comfortable for 2 people). The rooms are very well appointed, and the hotel seems to have been recently renovated (within the last few years at most). The rooms were very clean, and everything (AC, WiFi, TV, etc.) functioned perfectly. Great night's sleep, no problems with street noise. Hotel Centro is within a close (5 minute) walk to Termini station, so it's very convenient for travel both from the airport (Leonardo Express goes to Termini) and trains leaving Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Watch Out For The Bathroom Door !!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyThundersDTK
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I stayed here recently for 3 nights. The location was good . Staff were friendly & helpful & the room was clean & quiet. Breakfast was adequate with a buffet of pastries, fruit , bread , cereal , cheese , ham , ( watered down ) fruit juice & tea / coffee . All was well until very late on our last night when we closed the bathroom door & it decided to lock itself tightly shut from the inside . We had to go down to reception & get the concierge to force it open so we could rescue our things to pack for our early flight the next day. When we awoke it decided to lock itself again but luckily the door was slightly open this time ! Apart from this , we had a great time here . Rome is fantastic : )

Reviews.Title: “Good place to visit and stay”
Reviews.Author: TeroJ
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with friendly staff. Good breakfast, wifi in public areas. Near Termini

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and good location”
Reviews.Author: marianne77
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in november in this hotel. the location is great near termini station and steps from via nazional where you can find many bus lines stops, also it's a big shopping street too. the room was large enough by european standards, the bathroom was very clean. there was hairdryer, safe box, minibar, sattelite TV, and the room was very quiet. there was an elevator, a free wifi and there was a computer with internet access available near the reception, but it was very slow and old and sometimes not working properly, so if you have your own laptop, ask for the wifi password, it will be better, and you can use it near their computer. if you need to print anything they will tell you to go to an internet cafe next door. the breakfast was good, but we only saw the eggs the day we had breakfast early. the staff was helpful, but the reception will try to sell you any kind of tours they can. they even told us if we don't book the vatican tour with them, there will be huge queues and we won't be able to visit, and it was very expensive. so we bought online tickets to the vatican museums from the vatican site for a small extra fee because of what they said. and when we went, there wasn't any queues at all, because it was low season... overall, we were happy with our stay, location is great and excellent value for money, the hotel is clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: phoenixoftheflame
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 1 week in October/November of last year. Good hotel, clean and our room was spacious. Loved hearing the church bells chiming a fun song every supper time. There is a grocery store on the next block(very convenient), loads of restaurants close by (the tiny Chinese one across the street is super cheap and very tasty), and there is an internet cafe/long distance call center half a block away. We comfortably walked to the Coliseum from here. You couldn't find a more central hotel really. Close to termini station, Santa Maria Maggiore , Spanish steps, LOADS of shopping... etc. Breakfast had more to offer than our hotel in Venice did. Croissants, ham, cheese, bread, fruit, yogurt, pastries, hard boiled eggs, the coffee machine wasn't great. Rome's buses are a little intimidating and crowded in the evenings. I would recommend walking to your destination or taking a cab. Campo de Fiori is really cool, a must visit at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: MilleniumFalcon2009
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for two nights and chose Hotel Centro after reading about it on Tripadvisor. It was lovely! The staff we met at the hotel was excellent. They were very nice and helpful. The breakfast was a lot better than we expected after reading about it on Tripadvisor. We had fresh fruit, fresh croissants and bread rolls, nutella, jam, juice, freshly made cappuccinos and boiled eggs. We are veggies so we didn´t look for the ham and sausages. We booked room 510, which is a room with the possibility to have 2 extra beds. But the best is the big terrace! It was really nice to walk out on to the terrace in the morning and it was even better to sit there in the evening and drink wine. Even if I have to admit it was a bit dark :-) It was after all the end of October. But with the terracce lights on it was good enough. The overall finish of the hotel was ok. A bit worn and a some flaws here and there, but there was a built in charm that was hard for us to resist. The hotel is placed on a quiet side street but very central. We walked from the hotel to tourist attractions like Pantheon, Fontana di Trevi, St Peters cathedral, Piazza Navone and Colloseum. And it was a 10 minute walk to the train station to go with the airport express train. I wouldn´t hesitate a second to book (room 510) again if when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: maikTHESS
Reviews.Content: The location is very handy. Metro- station is very close and you can even walk to the center of the city. The room was fine, untill we saw a cockroach in the bathroom. Generally it looks clean though. The service was nothing special and one of the two receptionists was very rude. The rest of the stuff was fine though. Overall, the price is ok for this hotel and i would recommended it mainly due to its location and its price.

Reviews.Title: “Piacere, I will be back.”
Reviews.Author: BellaJLo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Centro. The staff was very kind, patient and helpful. Bruno was especially helpful at giving me Italian lessons and pointing us in the right direction for our daily adventures. We were right in the center of Rome without all the noise from the busy streets. There was an elevator available for when we would return without enough strength for another step. Air conditioning was a welcome relief.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_SwissParty
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Close to Termini, we were able to walk to many sights, the metro, etc. The hotel was clean, but the room was small for 2 adults, 2 teenagers and 4 suitcases. The breakfast buffet was okay, but get there early for the best selection of pastries, yogourts, etc. The coffee from the machine was not good, but our teenagers liked the hot chocolate. The juices were watered down. The staff were friendly and accommodated us as best as possible. We found the location quiet, even though we were centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: JennyGAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a good location but that is about it. The rooms were clean but very dark and dingy. The staff were almost rude except for one that was on duty on our final night. Dont think that they like tourist very much. Everywhere in Rome is expensive but would look elsewhere next time. Breakfast just made the grade.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: annie_battungbakal
Reviews.Content: The room is small for 4 of us, but it is clean and the breakfast is really plentiful. there are 3 beds and the sofa was converted into a bed. the only thing that I didn't like is the bath tub, it is not fully enclosed, so when you take a shower, the floor gets wet. I can;t call US using the phonecard (europa as suggested by Rick Steves) that I bought. I have to ask the front desk to give me an outside line. BUT, overall, the stay is satisfactory and would recomment the Hotel. Nice location too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Oz4
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here last September and although it did have some faults, I'd definately stay there again. + The location is fantastic. It's just off Via Nationale which is great for shopping and eating. And it's an easy walk distance to the Piazza della Republica and transport termi. We were right in the middle of it and loved it. + The room was tired but clean. For example, there was plaster coming off the wall in places, but the room was serviced to a great level every day. For me the rough edges just provided the charm. Spacious by European city standards. A separate bathroom with bath. We managed to fit a family of four (plus luggage for a month - with all the baby gear as we were traveling with a 9 month old) reasonably. + The private terrace off our room was just amazing. Large and extremely private with views over central Rome. One of the highlights of this entire trip was simply sitting out on the terrace enjoying a glass of wine while the kids were happy to play quietly. + Soundproofed. Although we were in the middle of it all, in our room we heard nothing. Well, except for the bells which rang from the Opera House (it used to be a church) and was only a couple of hundred metres or so from one side of our room. I only noticed it during the day and again, it added to the charm. (Note. it did not bother me to the point of being concerned about it waking our baby). + The staff. Were helpful when we asked, otherwise "hello" and a smile were all we saw of them. - The lift. Only one tiny little lift. A couple of flights of stairs are not a problem for us generally, but we were traveling with a baby in a pram. It just meant waiting on occasion (especially at check in or check out time). - TV. From memory I don't think there was anything remotely interesting for kids. The only English channels were news. Not a problem for us - we had a portable DVD player for the 4 year old! - The breakfast on offer was a little bit sad. If you're after a full continental like you'd find in 5 star chains, you won't find it here. We did manage to find enough coffee, pastries, cereal and some bread, meat and cheeses to get us on the way every day. So overall, okay. Final note: try to book the room on the top floor at the front of the hotel. More expensive but the large private terrace is worth it. I think this must be one of the hotels high points as the photos are on it's website. I loved this place and would return in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SD_Marks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Centro the first week of July. We thought the room was more than adequate for what we paid. The room was clean and a good size. Two beds were put together to make a king bed. The bathroom was quite big. I was concerned about this before we arrived and I was pleasantly surprised. Just had a shower, no tub. But we wouldn't have used a tub. The location was good. Only a few blocks from the main train/metro station. (Termini) And a block up from the Piazza Republica. We hardly used the metro at all as most things are in walking distance. And Rome is a place where you're going to do a lot of walking. The breakfasts were basic. Coffee/tea, juices, pastries, cereals, hard boiled eggs, breads, salami and meats, yogurt, fruit. Tip: as the attendant to make you a cappuccino. It is so much better than from the little coffee machine. We were there for a whole week and didn't have any complaints about the room or the hotel. The room was cleaned everyday. The staff were all friendly and had no problems speaking english to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandy054
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great. We stayed one night before our Cruise & one night after. We had different rooms on each occasion & both were roomy with lounge, plenty of room for luggage, nice seperate bathroom, good water pressure in shower, nice big windows that opened. Excellent location, we walked everywhere, very helpful friendly staff, would reccomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: gremaster71
Reviews.Content: This place is central located near the train station but just in front of the hotel there are many homeless slepping from late afternoon to the next morning. The decor of the hotel is a bit tired . Our room was small with no english Tv channel and the bed was not that confortable. The breakfast was more poor than basic and the coffee was horrible. The staff is helpfull and speek english.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: david9498
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 persons stayed here in May 06. Through the hotel, we arranged a taxi to meet us at the airport and take us right to the hotel. It is conveniently located near public transport stations and great little restaurants. We had 2 large triple rooms with big bathrooms. Breakfast was great and the staff were very very nice and helpful with everything. A true gem in Rome and a great value for families. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Amiatu
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Centro was great value for money. It was in a great location right near Termini station. For us, a young couple, it was within walking distance to everything - we didn't catch public transport the whole time we were in Rome. The staff were helpful and courteous but not intrustive. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We stayed there twice as we had a one night stop-over on the way back from Paris and the second room we were given was much better than the first. Try to avoid the rooms on the ground floor! They are a bit dungeon like! This was not a super-plush hotel, but it was all that we expected and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemum70
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely surprise. I booked it because we needed a cheap, clean, one-night stay before heading off on a tour and was pleasantly surprised by the spaciousness of our room. We are a family of four so they gave us a small apartment with 2 rooms with 2 queen beds and big fluffy pillows. Breakfast was exceelent and the staf friendly and helpful. Location was very convenient too.

Reviews.Title: “very Good Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Nelson2902
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Centro, large and clean rooms including bathroom. Breakfast was OK. Convenient to rail station and easy walking to all major attractions. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TandDG
Reviews.Content: Room was very small and dark. Walls were dirty and needed painting Air conditioning was noisy and couldn't be left on at night Saving grace was a tiny balcony Breakfast was very basic with a machine for hot drinks Close to rail station but not the nicest of areas to walk around

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: well_travelled32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 5 nights in 2 different rooms. The room for the first 2 was fine. It was large enough for two people bathroom was modern and a good size But the walls did need painting as they were a bit dirty and there was no English speaking channels - no cable tv. We then came back after a 3 night trip and the room we were given then was terrible. It was so tiny - no room for luggage without having to step over it all the time. The airconditioning didn't work well at all. The room was still hot with it on high. Again the walls were dirty and no cable tv. Bathroom was still modern but smaller. Lift is very slow and tiny. Only good points was the location. It felt safe even at night, was as close as you would want to be to a train station and in walking distance to a few of the sites. On other word of warning though, if the guy at the hotel desk suggests a particular restuarant to go to - DON"T. He must just be drumming up business for a friend or family member as the food was horrible, service just as bad and wasn't very cheap at all. Instead go to the cafe on Via Nazionale near the hotel between the supermarket and pharmacy - best one we went to in Italy. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Hotel Centro”
Reviews.Author: jaxscc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centro is in a pretty good location, but the rooms are tiny, the breakfast just ok and the men at the front desk were cool and unhelpful. Although I never take anything but costume jewelry while traveling, when my jewelry case was taken from the room I reported it immediately. The front desk was unconcerned and did nothing to help retreve it. They expressed no dismay and had little interest in the situation. I would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol&Gerard
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Centro after 7pm Saturday evening and the Receptionist knew our name and was expecting us. Swift check-in and bags taken up to room. Room was quite big for a city centre hotel. Very clean, laminate flooring, high ceiling in an old building and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom was quite big too, large shower and very clean. We slept extremely well and peacefully even though we were in the centre of Rome, it was so quiet at night. The breakfast was wonderful. Easy to use coffee machine, fruit juices, cereals, yoghurts, ham, salami, cheese, bread rolls, croissants and danish pastries - we didn't need to eat again until around 2pm and then only a snack. Staff were all very nice and although they spoke good English were always delighted when we tried a little Italian. Hotel very well situated, just along from the Opera Theatre and off the via Nazionale. Only took around 40 minutes to walk to the Piazza Novona. Would certainly stay here again if we return to Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfleis2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in a quad room. The beds were comfortable and the location was good. The day desk clerk was very helpful and spoke [perfect english. The breakfast was very good with a number of options. The only complaint that I had was the heat. The thermostat did not work. Even after it was fixed, it did not seem to work correctly. The temperature was in the forties and we were somewhat cold at night. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Centro Again”
Reviews.Author: wittyone
Reviews.Content: Once again, we are very pleased to say that our experience at Hotel Centro was absolutely wonderful. The staff is always delightful, helpful, and courteous. The breakfast is always wonderful--one of the biggest selections I have seen. The location for us was perfect--minutes away from Termini for easy train trips in and out of the city. It is right off of Via Nazionale which is a main artery. It is close to the Coloseum and many other sites and churches of major importance. Our room was always cleaned well. The room we had this time was the same room we had in March--with a terrace--and a bathtub/shower combination. The room was large enough and had a t.v. and minibar. For us, the most important thing about this hotel is the fact that everyone will go out of their way to help you whenever asked. Giovanni, Michael Bruno, Francesco and all the others have become like family to us. I think the rates are well in line with the rest of the city, especially since they are so helpful! It is not a super plush hotel, so don't expect extreme elegance and satin sheets, but it is comfortable and clean and very pleasant with a staff that is wonderful. I can't imagine going anywhere else when I return to Rome. It has been a pleasure for us to have stayed in this hotel. Grazie a tutti !! Ciao ! The Walters

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Centro was excellent”
Reviews.Author: cmonaussie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large, airconditioned and clean. Big fluffy towels. Fabulous breakfast included in the price. Fantastic handy position and very helpful, friendly, english speaking staff. A 5 - to minute walk from Termini station, and very easy to find, right off Via Nazionale. They have free Rome maps and recommended a terrific restaurant for us. Bathrooms were a good size.

Reviews.Title: “pokey rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jen&Mike
Reviews.Content: The room we were allocated (and we assumed they were all the same) was tiny! We had nowhere to put our two suitcases and could barely squeeze past the bed and bathroom doorway. The weather was very hot and the airconditioning really couldn't cope. We heard others at breakfast also complaining their air con was not cold. The bathroom was very small, but adequate - no bath. The shower was tiny and you had to be a very small person to fit into it without bumping the flimsy screen. The breakfasts were quite good for a European hotel, but the room was underneath the hotel and felt like a bunker! The one man who attended to the room insisted on smoking in the kitchen (which wafted into the dining room) and we saw cigarette ash all over the floor on one morning. It was meant to be no smoking. The lift was very very slow, and there was only one. To get to the lift involved a set of stairs, so not good for disabled people or people like us who were lugging heavy cases. The hotel "arranged" for a private car to take us to the airport, he said it was better than a taxi. In hindsight, we felt we were probably paying his mate to take us, the driver wouldn't carry or help with our bags to the car and he spoke no english. The location of this hotel is excellent, and if you want to see the sights, it is a perfect location. We returned to Rome a week later for one night and stayed elsewhere, which was far better. Centro is not bad for the money, but not brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimjb
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this well cared for, basic, little hotel in a super location in the heart of Rome. Quiet location but within walking distance of central Rome and many attractions. Very helpful staff and an excellent full breakfast. Very clean. Safe area. Nothing fancy but good value for your money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Centro Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Firenze 12, 00184 Rome, Italy
